refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The aq add cluster command creates a new cluster. Clusters can take various styles, defined by the cluster archetype. For example, high availability clusters would be configured with a "hacluster" archetype. Grid clusters would be configured with an archetype of "gridcluster".

refsection.title: Templates
refsection.para: This command will create the following cluster templates:

listitem.para: An object template that produces a output configuration profile for the cluster.

A normal template that will be included by member hosts to provide cluster-specific information. By default, this will try (via if_exists) to include the "features/HOST_ARCHETYPE/CLUSTER_ARCHETYPE/PERSONALITY/config" template. For example, a cluster called "nyvcs1", of archetype "hacluster" and personality "vcs" would have a template named "cluster/nyvcs1/client" which would try to include "features/HOST_ARCHETYPE/hacluster/vcs/config". Hosts which are members of the cluster will automatically include this template.
Specify the name of the new cluster. Cluster names are unique across all cluster types. The name of a cluster may only consist of alphanumeric characters.

A numeric value describing how many hosts can be down before the monitoring system declares a problem. This can be specified as an absolute number or as a percentage (by appending a "%" character on the argument). If a percentage is used, then the threshold data is exposed as both a percentage and an absolute value based on the current cluster population. The threshold value is exposed from Aquilon but the interpretation of that threshold is purely from within the monitoring system.

The archetype and personality of the cluster. This is the configuration of the cluster itself, not of the hosts that are members of the cluster. Typically the archetype indicates the style of cluster (HA, grid, etc) whereas the personality indicates the type of technology being used. For example, "hadoop", "vcs", etc.
The name of the template library to use when compiling the cluster, and all member hosts.

An alternative threshold to the main down_hosts_threshold. This threshold can be specified in the same manner as down_hosts_threshold: either as an absolute number or as a percentage. This threshold is intended to be observed by the monitoring system when the cluster is considered to be in a maintenance window. This allows you to indicate that during the maintenance period, it would be acceptable to have far more hosts down than during normal operations.
The maximum hosts that can be added to the cluster.
The status of the cluster. This defaults to "build".

example.title: Adding a 2-node HA cluster
example.programlisting: aq add_cluster --cluster nyvcs1 \ --campus ny \ --archetype hacluster --personality vcs --domain prod \ --down_hosts 0 --max_members 2

example.title: Adding a 3-node N+1 cluster
example.programlisting: aq add cluster --cluster nyvcs2 \ --campus ny \ --archetype hacluster --personality vcs --domain prod \ --down_hosts 1 --max_members 3

example.title: Adding a grid cluster
example.programlisting: aq add cluster --cluster nygrid1 \ --campus ny \ --archetype gridcluster --personality hadoop --domain prod \ --down_hosts 5% --max_members 2000

example.title: Adding an ESX cluster
example.programlisting: aq add cluster --cluster nyesx1 \ --campus ny \ --archetype esx_cluster --personality vsphere4.1 --domain prod \ --down_hosts 2 --max_members 16 --vm_to_host_ratio 16:1
